revised_title: Experimental Research on the Etiology and Treatment of Endemic Goitre
tldr: This study investigates the cause and treatment of endemic goitre through experimental research. The results show that goitre can be experimentally produced by consuming suspended matter from goitre-producing water and that it can be cured by the administration of intestinal antiseptics, such as lactic ferments. The study also suggests that the agent responsible for goitre production is likely a living organism parasitic in the human intestine.
